title: superlu-dist picks up system lapack instead of intel-mkl
body:
`superlu-dist@6.1.0 ^intel-mkl %gcc` picks up system lapack instead of intel-mkl

@balay @gchavez2 @davydden 

```
$ spack install superlu_dist ^intel-mkl@2019.0.117 %gcc@7.3.0
```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```
$ uname -a 
Linux xrm 3.10.0-693.5.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Oct 13 10:46:25 EDT 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Red Hat Enterprise Linux Workstation release 7.4 (Maipo)
``` 

### Build.out

[spack-build.out](https://pastebin.com/9FcZRBjr)

The issue is specifically in these lines : 
```
-- Using TPL_BLAS_LIBRARIES='-L/raid/home/sajid/packages/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-x86_64/gcc-7.3.0/intel-mkl-2019.0.117-wzqlcijwx7odz2x5chembudo5leqpfh2/compilers_and_libraries_2019.0.117/linux/mkl/lib/intel64 -L/lib64 -lmkl_intel_lp64 -lmkl_sequential -lmkl_core -lpthread -lm -ldl'
-- Looking for Fortran sgemm
-- Looking for Fortran sgemm - found
-- Looking for pthread.h
-- Looking for pthread.h - found
-- Looking for pthread_create
-- Looking for pthread_create - found
-- Found Threads: TRUE
-- Found BLAS: /usr/lib64/libblas.so
```
@balay  was able to build this properly using intel compiler and intel-mkl so this might be an issue with cmake not picking up the libraries properly.
